alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 8:51PM EDT until April 02 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Twiggs, Bibb and Monroe Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Dublin affecting Wilkinson, Washington, Johnson and Laurens Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25 feet, Major flooding occurs. Most of Old Balls Ferry Road north of Georgia Highway 57 will be under one to three feet of water. The water level reaches the bottom of the USGS gaging equipment near the boat ramp. Widespread flooding up to several feet deep of the woodlands near the river occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 25 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 14.4 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 17 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
